CreditsÂ¶

Credits to andrewbar for the initial code for the DFA. I found his 2008 project named “python-automata” on google code (code.google.com/p/python-automata). The project already supported deterministic finite automaton (DFA), minimisation algorithms, cross products between DFAs and much more. I’ve added :

  • a non-deterministic finite automaton (NFA) class that supports simulation
  • an abstracted a Finite Automaton class that is herited by both DFA and NFA
  • added functions to enumerate and a second pretty_print function
  • added an algorithm to create a DFA from a NFA
  • added a parser that takes a regex in input and that returns a NFA
  • Added a prompt to create NFA and DFA.

For bug report or other inquieries : https://github.com/DjAntaki/python_automata

antaki.vincent@gmail.com
